title: Customer says Asian Paints is too expensive for me
Customer is not responding to my calls and WhatsApp messages
Customer says - How can you prove that AP is better than local contractors?
Customer has a trusted local contractor who he has been working with for many years.
Customer is already using / interested in a competitor branded service.
Don’t know how to plan for sales targets.
Not getting enough local leads.
Customers are not responding to cold calling. Conversion rates are low.
Customer site is very far away from my area.
Customer is asking only for 1 wall
Customer has requests for appointment at abnormal times.
Customer has a negative image of Asian Paints. Customer had a bad experience with us earlier.
Customer does not want to do business with my dealer
Customer only wants a quotation to understand our prices.
Customer only wants to select colors - doesn't want service.
I am late for customer appointment. Customer is angry.
I do not have my measurement tools for site visit
I do not have some design catalogues. Customer says come back again.
Customer says he asked for AP service and not a local dealer service
I am a new Associate. Customer is not confident that I can deliver.
Customer has read up on the internet and firing questions
Customer says process is too long
How to create stars when understanding the customer’s needs?
Customer is confused and not giving details about his design / budget needs
Customer is asking for unusual things at site.
Customer is asking for painting work on damp / undulating walls
Customer has a large family and everyone has their own different needs
How to create stars when giving solutions to the customer?
Customer is not agreeing with the site measurements I have done.
Customer wants the house painted by a certain date. But the job is big and will take double the time.
Customer does not agree with the product I have suggested
Customer says the quotation is from the dealer and not AP. Is it genuine?
How to create stars when doing site assessment?
Customer wants the color selection to be done at site, he cannot come to store
How to create stars when creating a quotation?
Customer doesn’t trust that I am an SPS representative
Customer wants a detailed item by item breakup of the quotation
Customer is asking for free sample
Customer doesn’t understand the difference between different paint products
Customer has come for color consulting and has taken the whole day
Customer says AP website has quoted lower prices
Customer says quotation is out of his budget
Loyal customer is asking for high discounts
Customer is not closing the deal. He doesn’t take my calls or gives excuses every time I call.
Customer asks why should he pay the cheque to the dealer?
Customer says I have a cheaper quotation from others
Customer is bargaining on every item of the quotation
Customer does not agree to do the advance payment, asks for materials first
Customer doesn’t agree with payment terms
How to create stars when planning site execution with the customer?
All the regular contractors are busy and the customer wants to start the work immediately
How to create stars when sharing the work plan with the customer?
Dealer has recommended a contractor who has many complaints in the past
Contractor does not want to do the job because the amount he will get is too less for him
Contractor does not care about the customer’s deadline
How to create stars when telling the customer what he’s going to get at the end of the project?
Material is not available, work cannot start on time
Contractor says he won’t work at night to finish the work faster
Meeting your sales targets successfully
Meeting your project deadlines successfully
Workers have not come on the first day of work.
Customer wants to postpone site work as he needs more time.
Workmen have shifted customer’s personal items. Customer wants the workmen removed from site.
Workmen have damaged / broken the customer’s items. Customer wants it reimbursed.
Customer is angry that workmen have entered their private room without permission.
Customer called to say that workmen are making noise.
Workmen are not maintaining cleaning and safety protocols.
Customer has to pay the next installment but is delaying. Says come after a few days.
How to create stars when handing over the finished site?
Customer is unhappy with the quality of paint finish (brush marks, patches).
Contractor is not available for touch-ups. He has been deployed in other projects. Site handover stalls.
Customer complains that the warranty has not been activated.
Customer is angry that the furniture has not been put back properly on the site.
Customer is not able to give me referrals.
Workmen are late everyday delaying the site work. Customer is angry.
Workmen are taking double the time to complete each item, job getting delayed.
Contractor has withdrawn all his workmen because of payment issues.
Site is going to stop due to lack of paint materials and there is no stock in the shop.
Customer is complaining about paint dust / smell on site.
Family members have asthma. Customer wants the workmen to take care.
Customer is out of town. They want daily updates on site progress.
How to create stars during site supervision?
Bad weather is delaying completion of the project.
Customer feels that shade on the wall does not match the color selected.
Customer has some other parallel work going on. It is interrupting the painting job.
Customer has added an extra room to the site but wants it done for less price.
Contractor has confirmed that he has finished the job. Customer says it is still incomplete.
Painting is halfway through. Workmen have found undulations / leakages on site which were not detected earlier. Customer is not aware.
Too many sites and leads. I don’t know how to manage.
While I am supervising an important WIP site, another customer wants me to come to his site immediately.
